tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Annexed: May 18, 1812, Quebec. General Order. Re. appointment of Major Francis Battersby of the 8th Regiment to the command of the Glengary Light Infantry Fencibles with the temporary and local rank of Lieutenant Colonel to receive the allowances and to be invested with the authority of a Lieutenant Colonel commanding a corps. Major George McDonnell will continue to superintend the recruiting parties of the levy under the orders of Col. Baynes. All reports and applications solely for the levy of the Glengary Light Infantry are to be sent to the Adjutant General direct & not to the Commanding Officer of the District. Re. musket ammunition to be issued for the annual practice of the Regiments in this command. This ammunition to be issued from the ordnance store as required by the corps for immediate use on the requisition of the Commanding Officers. A certified return of the effective strength of Regiments will be sent by the Adjutant General to Major General Glasgow, Royal Artillery.
Regarding a Lutheran clergyman named Weagant who desires to take Holy Orders in the Church of England.

Transmits report of persons of the 3rd Regt. York Militia who have deserted since 1 July 1812.
tagPerson: Chewett, W., Lt. Col. York Militia

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Acknowledges letters informing him of the proclamation appointing 19 June as a day of fast.
Regarding reinforcements for the Niagara district.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Account of team work done at Prescott in building the stockade fort between 4 July and 24 October.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Extract from proceedings of Council on the petition of Peter Flummerfeldt, for a grant of the Salt Spring.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Enclosed: June 27, 1814, Kingston. Petition.
Christopher Vaty gives information against Abram Winn respecting traitorous conduct.
Further remarks on the traitors held for punishment.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Account of payments made by Thomas McCormick, paymaster, 4th. Regt., Lincoln Militia.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Requesting him to forward copies of the Laws, the address of the House and Mr. Strachan's sermon.
Petition of persons confined in the York jail (Joseph Fowler, Adam Chrysler, Griffis Culver, Isaac Pettit, Wm. Carpenter, Datis Linsey, Wadsworth Philip.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: paymaster 1st Regt. Essex Militia. Account for stationery.
Appointment as attorney general.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Enclosure: Dec. 16, 1814. Charlottevilles. Return described above.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Advising him that the post at York is to be fortified as the seat of the government. [?] establishment to be transferred from Kingston to York. Reasons for this change.
Regarding the traitors, and seeking a respite until the 20 July for them.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Ordering the distribution of an address of the House to its constituents to members, and copies of a sermon by Rev. Mr. Strachan.
Acknowledging letters of 25 and 26 May. Directions have been given to Barrack Dept. at Fort George regarding stores and repairs.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Transmits copy of Order in Council, dated 16 March 1810, regarding Hugh Mulholland and Nathaniel Hilleger.

Enclosure: George Cutter's information re. John Lyon & person deemed suspicious characters associating with him such as Alfred Barrett, Gideon Orton, Timothy Wheeler, James Mulot, Abraham Walker, Simeon Morton & Calvin Wood.
Has transmitted return of persons who have deserted.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Forwarding receipts for writs of election for London district.
Resigns as judge in the District of Cornwall.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Proceedings of a Militia General Court Martial held at Kingston on Dec. 6, 1813, for the trial of Joseph Seeley.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Report on the petition of John Smith for land.
Acknowledging letter of 12 instant.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Return of work performed by the 1st, Regt., Dundas Militia, Engineering Dept.
Petition of sundry persons for pardon of Aaron Stevens convicted of treason.
Instructions for printing 150 copies of proclamation for dissolving the parliament.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Requesting leave of absence for six weeks.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Names of Benajah Mallory & Isaac Petit were omitted in his general return of person who have deserted to the U.S. Has therefore enclosed an additional return.
Enclosed: (1) Report of cost of the courts martial, between 1 and 20 January 1814.

Re. Major Stuart's command at York & reports on persons thought suspicious & encloses the depositions. Recommends the Rev. Dr. Strachan, William Allan, Duncan Cameron, Thomas Ridout, Alex. Wood, & Capt. Peter Robinson for the Committee of information.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
tagDescription: Order to print copies of the militia Act.
Enclosure: Joseph Burton's information re. Benjamin Davis, Moses McGrath.

tagPerson: Peters, John, Lt. Col. 1st Regt. Northland Militia
tagDescription: Has forwarded a return of persons gone to the States to the sheriff, Newcastle district.
Oath of road commissioners for Midland District transmitted. (Document not at this place.)
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812

tagDescription: Enclosure: Report of the Committee of the Executive Council on the above mentioned subject.

Petition of persons confined in the York jail York. (John Parker, Samuel Carson, Levi Lawrence, Job Horsey, Frederick Horsey, Phillip Beamer, John Beamer, Jacob Shafe, Luther Cooley, Griffis Culver, George Porter, Jacob Decow, Noah Force, Wm. Crandot, Jabish Thorington, Wm. Sickles).
Statement of the conduct of his regiment and proceedings against officers.

Committee of the Executive Council re inhabitants deserting their land to join the enemy; Commissioners should be appointed from the Magistrates of the districts where the lands so deserted are situated.
Requests renewal of his leave of absence.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to December 1812
